newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan textiles rise on rising order hope.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan textiles rise on rising order hope.

text.p: Taiwan's textile shares rose by mid-morning on Thursday on hopes that the Untited States may transfer textile orders to Taiwan from China, brokers said.

After 75 minutes, textiles rose 0.77 percent while the overall index rose only 0.27 percent. Far Eastern Textile surged T$1 or 3.28 percent to T$31.5 and Chung Shing Textile rose 25 cents or 1.82 percent to T$14.05.
Last Friday, the United States announced punitive charges against China's 1996 textile and apparel quotas, citing transhipments of Chinese textiles in voilation of a 1994 trade agreement.
"Many expected the U.S. textile orders to transfer to Taiwan from mainland China," said Ben Lee of Nomura Securities.
Also, he said, polyester drawn texturized yarn and polyester filament prices have been rising recently.
"This indicates the textile industry has almost bottomed-out, showing signs of recovery," Lee said.
